reviews.review: I really enjoy this game and its worth every single dollar that i paid for.... Since I have a PHD in giving colonoscopys i have very little time to play since i am shoving a tube up someones rear end. But this game is so much fun to play in my free time!

The game is fun for about the first 50 hours. After that, it's better if you just leave the game and never play it again. You will go up against people with 3,000 hours in DBD that will ruin your day. Bad teammates, and unfair mechanics, horrible updates,  and just a unfun time in general. I don't think you should buy the game if you want to have fun. Spend your money on something else.
i hat this game more then i hate myself solid 10/10

Sehr empfehlenswert. Macht richtig Spa√ü, vor allem mit den Killern die in den Red-Ranks campen und tunnlen.

It's a pretty good game that'll make you hate everyone buried under fifty layers of meaningless under-explained mechanics. (What the fuck is a protection hit? What's the difference between mangled and bleeding and injured? Blinded and oblivious?)

But boy is it satisfying to just watch a survivor team go through a cascade of failure right at the end of a match.

Oh wait, NFTs.

Yes, I would recommend this game to others, I've actually been trying to get other people to play with me. I pretty much like everything about the game except when people tunnel or camp. I would like an update to the game where we can report people for tunneling and/or camping. When they do that, especially, at the start of the game it makes it no fun and costs us our ranks that we've been working hard to get. Otherwise it is a really fun game and I'm gonna keep playing it.

definitely one of my favorite games

This review is purely from the survivor side. Everything I say can only be applied to the survivor experience.

It's a damn shame that Steam only allows you to give your review a thumbs down or a thumbs up, because I think this game deserves a thumbs right/left, and I think a major factor in that is how you play it. There's 2 kinds of ways that Dead By Daylight can be played as a survivor, those ways being in solo queue, and in an SWF. 

Coming from someone that has played almost exclusively solo queue, it's a...fairly strange experience. Solo queue is generally a worse experience than an SWF, but when that occasional clutch escape or the incredible outplay happens, it REALLY shines through. The rush you feel from winning a seemingly hopeless situation and knowing that you and only YOU pulled it off is incredible. While good teammates with a sense of human decency are rare and hard to come by, when they turn up it's a feeling like no other.

On the other hand, an organized SWF with your friends is a more well-rounded experience. It's clear that this game was designed to be played with friends, as shown by the Solo-Q Experience (TM) being the wonky mess it is. It's more fun overall, as you have friends to talk to and you can rely information to each other, but the high moments aren't as good as those in solo queue.

I feel as though many dislike this game because of the difference between solo queue and SWF's. As well as solo queue having awesome high moments, it's low moments are VERY low. The community of this game isn't great either, and I think that's another huge put-off to this game, as well as the numerous bugs, weird balancing issues, and the subpar console experience. There is so much more to this game than just those things, but I think i will leave it at this.

Overall, I think this game is alright. It's got some wonderful things, some ok things, and some AWFUL things. If you can look past all the bad things however, this game is extremely fun to play, especially with friends. If you've got a couple of friends laying around in a discord group together, I suggest giving this a go.

Okay, after 70 hours I can conclusively deduce that this game is trash and all the rumours about its community are all true.

Playing as a new solo player is misery. Playing as a new Killer is actual cock and ball torture. All you will get is sweatlord team after sweatlord team, abusing the same crutch god perks, abusing voice comms and abusing you ingame and in the chat afterward. There are 2, maybe 3 killers in the game who actually get to play the fucking game thanks to their mobility but that's all ya get. Everyone else? You get to walk at generators and watch them light up within 4 minutes every single game.

Genuinely this game is filled with the most vile mannered, sweatlord, no-fun-allowed children I have ever seen in a PvP game in my life. I would tell you how the actual gameplay is, but more than half the time [b]I don't get to fucking play[/b] because of all the infinite looping and mobility and crutch perks survivors get. That's ignoring the rampant abuse of voice comms that lets them evade you flawlessly and know your every move.


Don't buy this game. It has potential yeah, but the balancing and the community utterly ruin it. IF you have some friends and play together as survivors, or as 5 of you in customs, it can be fun. But if you want to play as a Killer for fuck's sake move along, there's nothing for you here but misery.

Edit: Also the community moderators are lunatics and hand out weeklong bans like alms to the poor. Call a person a clown? Ban. Call survivors honourless curs? Ban. This community's plagued from top to the bottom. xD

A toxic community at high ranks. After 20 hours I already had people comment on my Steam profile rude things. 
Playing with friends is my main enjoyment out of this game. 

Having to purchase DLC killers and survivors sucks. Recommend buy on sale.
